Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant met the residency requirement under s. 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Applicant was absent for 551 days over four years
Defendant_Behavior: Maintained significant ties to Colombia while applying for Canadian citizenship
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to meet physical presence and residential connection requirements
Legal_Standard: Centralization of mode of existence in Canada
Applicable_Legislation: Citizenship Act, s. 5(1)(c); Federal Courts Act, s. 21
Procedural_Issue: Appeal from citizenship judge to Federal Court under s. 14(5) of Citizenship Act and s. 21 of Federal Courts Act
Evidence_Used: Duration and frequency of absences from Canada
Nature and extent of business interests in Colombia
Application_Basis: Residency and establishment of primary mode of living in Canada
Governing_Rule: Applicant must centralize their mode of existence in Canada
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient demonstration of residential centrality in Canada
Cause_Description: Applicant's frequent absences and stronger connection to Colombia
Evidence_Handling: Evaluation of travel records, business ties, and personal connections
Evidence_Assessment: Comprehensive review of Koo factors and residency indicators
Decision_Rationale: The applicant did not demonstrate that Canada was the central mode of their existence
Decision_Making_Body: Citizenship judge, reviewed by Federal Court
Legal_Standard_Applied: Centralization of mode of existence test from Koo v. Canada
